alert.note: Alert for Elliott (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 17 at 12:34PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Elliott County through 100 PM EDT... At 1233 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Newfoundland, or over Sandy Hook, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Bruin around 1240 PM EDT. Culver around 1245 PM EDT. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 300 PM EDT for southeastern and east central Kentucky.
